p: The start and finish of the austenitization temperatures are shown to a greater extent in Figure 4b. The linear dilatation curves are crossed by tangent lines, which help us to accurately determine the initial temperatures when heating Ac 1 and Ac 3. Another helpful function is the derivation of the dilatation curve on which we can also observe the deviation of the dilatation curve from its linear direction. Using derivation of dilatation curves, we can more accurately determine the exact point of deviation of the curve.
